result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul T Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervison fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, Defendant's Notifications

Defendant Paul T Rice in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh.  Defendant Paul T Rice in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 5. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 5. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Paul T Rice appears by phone from Red Granite Correctional Institution along with attorney Raj Kumar Singh who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Singh advises he's had some plea negotiations with DA Pelrine regarding resolution of the case. Atty Pelrine advises of what the State would be offering. Defendant uncertain of what he wishes to do. State advises offer won't be good after today, matter will then proceed to trial. Defendant advises he wishes to accept the State's offer. Court questions defendant on accepting of the offer. Court sets plea hearing, will keep the trial on the calendar until a plea is taken. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Paul T Rice appears by phone from Dodge Correctional Institution along with attorney Raj Kumar Singh who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions speedy trial request by defendant. Atty Singh advises, per statute, court has 120 days to conduct trial after the speedy trial request as defendant is in custody in the prison system.  Atty Pelrine advises the State has not received the written speedy trial request from defendant while he's in prison, only received the oral request from defendant. Atty Pelrine feels setting trial in March shouldn't be a problem. Court sets trial for 3/09 - 3/10/15 in a #1 position. Court leaves January pretrial on the calendar. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Paul T Rice appeared by video conference from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Linda Jean Schaefer appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges contained within Information, max. penalties. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense requests speedy trial. Set for trial (2 days) and pre-trial. Bond continues as is.
Arraignment on November 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.
State's Discovery Demand
State Exh. 1 - Officer Bilodeau's narrative report, Exh. 2 - Sgt. Zager's narrative report dated 7/04/14, Exh. 3 - Sgt. Zager's supplemental narrative report dated 9/03/14.

Defendant Paul T Rice in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Paul T Rice in custody.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken from Sgt. Greg Zager, sworn. State offers Exh.'s 1, 2 & 3. Court receives. Cross. Redirect. Recross. Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings. State had Information ready for today but will be adding a couple counts of Burglary after talking to Sgt. Zager. Atty Pelrine requests a week to file the Information. Atty Pelrine advises defendant may be tranported to prison before Arraignment date, requests video appearance for that hearing. Defendant has no objection to video appearance. Court grants request, arraignment is not an evidentury hearing, defendant can appear by video. Bond remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests prelim. be set within 20 day time limit. Bond set.
